docs.text: Overview This is a test to assess whether the IAPR TC11 can use GitHub pages as a feature-full and reliable hosting service. The website is built automatically every time someone makes a change on source files and commits them. It means that, provided you have a GitHub account authorized to make changes to the associated repository, you can: click on the pen icon on top right, make changes save/commit and the website is automatically updated. There is no hosting fees, no limits on the number of collaborators, and a great potential for automation. Also, anyone can suggest changes, and managers can review and eventually accept them with a couple of clicks.
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: This is a test to assess whether the IAPR TC11 can use GitHub pages as a feature-full and reliable hosting service. The website is built automatically every time someone makes a change on source files and commits them. It means that, provided you have a GitHub account authorized to make changes to the associated repository, you can: click on the pen icon on top right, make changes save/commit and the website is automatically updated. There is no hosting fees, no limits on the number of collaborators, and a great potential for automation. Also, anyone can suggest changes, and managers can review and eventually accept them with a couple of clicks.
